CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper November 1, 1958, pg. 1, reads: "3 Die in Car-Train Crash - George Kasardo Jr., towing company employe [employee], explains how a freight train rammed into this car in Braddock, Sunday, knocked the door of the car open and hurled the driver, McKinley Carlock, his wife, Beulah, and daughter, Mrs. Thelma B. Swinton under the wheels of freight cars, killing all three members of the North Braddock family.  The tragedy occurred at the Sixth and Halket St. railroad crossing. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: George Kasardo Jr. pointing to wrecked car driven by McKinley Carlock involved in fatal crash with freight train
